title: Peter Lee of Microsoft Research on the Future of Computing

json.text: I think the idea of operating a computer -- the use of that verb, when we think about computing,
And so instead of us as people directing and operating a machine,
will have the intelligence to understand our intentions,
and our needs, and will proactively serve those needs.
That's an ideal future that I think is at the heart of
organizations like the University of Michigan School of Information.
So, I really like this sort of rubric of
getting past the idea of operating a computer
and having computers instead proactively and intelligently serve our needs.
